question: What is data?
correct: Information that is collected or observed
options: Information that is collected or observed

question: Which of these is NOT a type of chart we learned about?
What is the x-axis in a bar graph?
What is the purpose of collecting data?
correct: To answer questions and discover new information
options: To answer questions and discover new information

question: What is the purpose of a graph?
correct: To help us see patterns in data
options: To help us see patterns in data

question: What is a label in a graph?
correct: A word or title that tells us what the graph is about
options: A word or title that tells us what the graph is about

question: If you are collecting data on favorite fruits in your class, what are the pieces of information you would collect from each student?
correct: Their name and their favorite fruit
options: Their name and what they had for breakfast
Their favorite TV show and favorite game
Their name and their favorite fruit

question: You see a bar chart showing the number of pets owned by different students.  A bar for 'Dogs' is twice as tall as the bar for 'Cats'. What can you conclude?
correct: Twice as many students own dogs as cats.
options: Dogs are better pets than cats.
Twice as many students own dogs as cats.

question: If you want to show how a plant has grown over time, what type of graph would be best to use?
A survey asks students about their favorite sport. 10 students like soccer, 5 like basketball, and 5 like swimming.  If this was on a pie chart, which sport would have the biggest slice?
Why is it important to label the axes of a graph?
correct: So that people know what the graph is showing.
options: To make the graph look more colorful.
So that people know what the graph is showing.
To make the graph harder to read.

question: What is the first step you should take when you want to collect data?
correct: Decide what question you want to answer.
options: Decide what question you want to answer.
Guess what the data will show.

question: If you are making a bar chart to show the number of different colored cars in a parking lot, what would you put on the y-axis?
options: The names of the car owners

question: A survey about favorite ice cream flavors shows that vanilla is the most popular. How would this look on a bar chart?
correct: The bar for vanilla would be the tallest.
options: The bar for vanilla would be the shortest.
All the bars would be the same height.
The bar for vanilla would be the widest.
The bar for vanilla would be the tallest.

question: A survey asks, 'What is your favorite pet?' What kind of data is being collected?
A pie chart shows that 50% of the students chose pizza. If there are 30 students in the class, how many chose pizza?
Which of the following is an example of data?
options: The heights of all students in a class.
The favorite colors of students in a class.
The number of books read by each student in a class.

question: If a bar graph is showing the number of sunny days per month for a year, what would be the most appropriate title?
Why is it important to choose the right type of chart for your data?
correct: To clearly show the story the data is telling.
options: Because some charts are easier to draw.
To make the data look more complicated.
To confuse the people reading the chart.
To clearly show the story the data is telling.

question: If you are collecting data on how many hours students spend on homework each night, what would be the best way to record this information?
correct: A tally chart or a frequency table
options: Drawing pictures of students doing homework.
A tally chart or a frequency table
